author: Staff Reporter
text:
Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam leader Vaiko said that there was corruption even in procurement of tree saplings for Chief Minister’s birthday celebrations in the State.

Talking to presspersons here on Wednesday, he said that there were financial malpractices in procuring tree saplings to the tune of Rs. 68 crore.

The State would witness a remarkable change in the forthcoming Assembly elections similar to the change that took place in 1967, he noted.

“The All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) failed miserably on all fronts. Opinion polls by visual media should not attempt to change the mindset of people. There is mutual understanding among the constituents of the People’s Welfare Front,” the MDMK leader added.

On Minister’s comments

Reacting to the “sarcastic comments” made by Minister for Power R. Viswanathan against the PWF, Mr. Vaiko said that there was no confusion within the PWF. Chaos and confusion were only within the AIADMK.
title: Vaiko predicts change after Assembly polls
